NACE_level1: D - Electricity, Gas, Steam and Air Conditioning Supply
NACE_level2: D35 - Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
NACE_level2_extra1: C20 - Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
NACE_level2_extra2: H49 - Land transport and transport via pipelines
NACE_level_3: D35.1 - Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
justification: Climate neutrality involves energy, manufacturing, and transport sectors due to their emissions impact.

target_content: The total quantity of allowances for the new emissions trading system should follow a linear trajectory to reach the emission reduction target for 2030, taking into account the cost-efficient contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005 and of the additional sectors, a combined cost-efficient contribution of 42 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005.
NACE_level1_extra2: D - Electricity, Gas, Steam and Air Conditioning Supply
NACE_level2_extra1: H49 - Land transport and transport via pipelines
NACE_level2_extra2: D35 - Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
NACE_level_3: F41.2 - Construction of residential and non-residential buildings
NACE level3_extra2: D35.1 - Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
justification: The target involves buildings and road transport, indicating involvement of construction and transport sectors.

target_content: Upgrade national targets in line with an EU-wide reduction of 40% in the ESR sectors compared to 2005. Member States contribute to the overall EU reduction in 2030 with targets ranging from -10% to -50% below 2005 level (sectors: transport, buildings, agriculture and waste)
NACE_level2: H49 - Land transport and transport via pipelines
NACE_level2_extra2: A1 - Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
NACE_level_3_extra1: F41.2 - Construction of residential and non-residential buildings
justification: The ESR sectors include transport, buildings, agriculture, and waste, aligning with these NACE categories.

target_content: Achieve an EU net greenhouse gas removal of 310 million tonnes CO2 equivalent per year for the land use, land use change and forestry (LULUCF) sector
NACE_level1_extra1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level_3: A2.1 - Silviculture and other forestry activities
justification: LULUCF involves forestry and land use, supporting choices of agriculture and related sectors.

target_content: For the period from 2021 to 2025 each Member State shall ensure that greenhouse gas emissions from the sector do not exceed greenhouse gas removals, calculated as the sum of total emissions and total removals on its territory in all of the land accounting categories (no debit rule). The accounting benchmark for the EU is ca. -229 Mt CO2e/yr for 2021-2025.
NACE_level1_extra1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2_extra1: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
NACE_level_3: A2.1 - Silviculture and other forestry activities
justification: The target focuses on emissions and removals related to land use, pointing to agriculture and waste sectors.

target_content: Each Member State shall ensure that the annual sum of its greenhouse gas emissions and removals on its territory and in all of the land reporting categories, in each year in the period from 2026 to 2030, does not exceed the limit established by a linear trajectory, ending in 2030 on the target set out for that Member State(no debit rule)
NACE_level1_extra1: E - Water Supply, Sewerage, Waste Management and Remediation Activities
NACE_level2_extra1: E38 - Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities, materials recovery
NACE_level_3: A2.1 - Silviculture and other forestry activities
justification: Like TA1.13, this target involves land use and emissions/removals, aligning with agriculture and waste sectors.

target_content: To achieve 55% reduction of GHG emission by 2030, methane emissions related to energy production and consumption should be reduced by 58% compared to the level in 2020

target_content: Reach energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector by 2040. To reach energy neutrality and the additional treatment of nitrogen, GHG emissions would be reduced by 4,86 million tonnes (37,32 % of the avoidable emissions from the sector)

target_content: The contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62 % compared to 2005 (increasing the linear emissions reduction factor from 2.2 % per year up to 4.4 %)
